p: Therefore, bacteria such as R. eutropha, P. aeruginosa, P. mendocina, A. chroococcum, and A. beijerinckii can simultaneously produce PHAs and other biosurfactants by utilization of the same organic substrate. Nevertheless, the technological performance of the bacteria during coupled biosurfactant and PHA production leads to a decreased PHA production. Particularly, the optimum operating conditions for biosurfactant and PHA production are actually different [ 50].
